arts.ttl: Jonny Howson fitness admission encapsulates special Middlesbrough commitment after win
arts.sum: Michael Carrick admits Jonny Howson was not signed off as fit to play in Middlesbrough ’s QPR victory on Tuesday evening, but insisted he help the team during its current injury crisis. Praising Howson after for the special commitment he’d shown to Boro, Carrick said: “Jonny should never have played tonight, to be honest.

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick singles out three Middlesbrough players after QPR win that keeps play offs there
arts.sum: When reflecting on the win after, while Carrick was happy with the response of every Boro player from the weekend, it was the performances of makeshift centre-backs Jonny Howson and Neto Borges, as well Samuel Iling-Junior at left-back that earned them special recognition from the head coach. Michael Carrick was relieved to see his Middlesbrough side keep their play-off chances alive with an important victory over QPR, as he singled out three players for specific praise.

Embed from Getty Images QPR’s poor run continued as they were beaten at Middlesbrough. Here’s how we rated each Rangers player in the 2-1 defeat at the Riverside Stadium. arts.ttl: Cifuentes disappointed after QPR lose ‘quite equal’ game
arts.sum: Marti Cifuentes felt QPR were edged out in an “equal, quite balanced game” by Middlesbrough. Rangers were beaten 2-1 at the Riverside Stadium and have now lost four matches in a row – and seven of their past nine. arts.ttl: Middlesbrough beat QPR to boost top-six aims
arts.sum: Tommy Conway and Anfernee Dijksteel struck either side of half-time as Middlesbrough beat QPR 2-1 to edge themselves to within three points of the Sky Bet Championship play-off places.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough edge QPR victory to close in on Championship play-off places
arts.sum: Steve Cook pulled a goal back for the visitors with 10 minutes remaining.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough v QPR line-ups: Frey back for Rangers
arts.sum: Michael Frey, fit again after missing the defeat at West Brom with a minor injury, is back in the QPR side at the Riverside Stadium. Frey replaces Paul Smyth in attack – Rangers’ only change from Saturday’s game. Middlesbrough: to follow. QPR: Nardi, Dunne, Cook, Edwards, Paal, Colback, Morgan, Saito, Yang, Chair, Frey.
